Sketch Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the given Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and translation vector [0.0, 0.2372, 0.0]. Now, create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by this coordinate system. The sketch contains one face (face_1), and the following loops (loop_1) and lines: 1. line_1: [0.0, 0.0926] to [0.0, 0.1657] 2. line_2: [0.0, 0.1657] to [0.0814, 0.1657] 3. line_3: [0.0814, 0.1657] to [0.0814, 0.2424] 4. line_4: [0.0814, 0.2424] to [0.684, 0.2424] 5. line_5: [0.684, 0.2424] to [0.684, 0.1664] 6. line_6: [0.684, 0.1664] to [0.75, 0.1664] 7. line_7: [0.75, 0.1664] to [0.75, 0.0989] 8. line_8: [0.75, 0.0989] to [0.684, 0.0989] 9. line_9: [0.684, 0.0989] to [0.684, 0.0] 10. line_10: [0.684, 0.0] to [0.0814, 0.0] 11. line_11: [0.0814, 0.0] to [0.0814, 0.0926] 12. line_12: [0.0814, 0.0926] to [0.0, 0.0926] Extrusion Now, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with the extrude depth 0.2372 and with no extrusion opposite to the normal direction. Apply a uniform scale factor of 0.75 to the sketch. This will create a slightly tapered rectangular prism. For the operation, create a new solid body. The dimensions of the part are length = 0.75, width = 0.2372, and height = 0.75.</description>

prompt: <description>**Construct the first part: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom.** 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Set the euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) degrees and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.25, 0.0). 2. **Draw the 2D sketch.** On face 1, create loop 1. Within loop 1, create the following lines: - line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.5) - line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.5), End Point (0.0, 0.5) - line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.5), End Point (0.0, 0.0) 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.125 units and the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.125 units. This will create a slightly tapered top and bottom on the prism. **Construct the second part: A three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, elongated along its central axis.** 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Set the euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) degrees and the translation vector to (0.375, 0.25, 0.125). 2. **Draw the 2D sketch.** On face 1, create loop 1. Within loop 1, create the following lines: - line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.375), End Point (0.375, 0.0) - line 2: Start Point (0.375, 0.0), End Point (0.375, 0.375) - line 3: Start Point (0.375, 0.375), End Point (0.0, 0.375) 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Apply a scaling factor of 0.375 to the sketch. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.0625 units and the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0625 units. This will create a flat-topped prism that is elongated along its central axis. 5. **Subtract the second part from the first part.** Apply the subtraction boolean operation to the second part, removing material from the first part to create a triangular cutout on one of the faces of the rectangular prism. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces.</description>
